data.title: Tournament
data.solution:
n = gets.to_i
matches = n.times.map { gets[0].tr("ZPT", "100").to_i }

ans = []
while matches.size > 1
  matches = matches.each_slice(2).map { |x, y| x | y }
  ans << matches.sum
end

puts ans
data.statement:
You are given the pairings of an elimination tournament with [[n]] = 2 ** <<k>> players of the game Starcraft. Each player plays one race from either: {{Terran}}, {{Protoss}} or {{Zerg}}.

You are very worried about game balance and decide to figure out the maximum number of {{Zerg}} players that can qualify in the successive <<k>> rounds.  Print the result in <<k>> lines.

<<NOTE:>> The pairings are made by successively choosing two consecutive remaining players. That is:

`
Zerg    --
          |-- Next player --
Terran  --                  |
                            |-- Next player
Terran  --                  |
          |-- Next player --
Protoss --
`

data.constraints:
There is an integer <<k>> such that [[n]] = 2 ** <<k>> ([[n]] is a power of two).
4 <= [[n]] <= 64
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read player:string(256)

write maximum number of Zerg at each round
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the number of players in the tournament.
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> The race of the player. Either {{Terran}}, {{Protoss}} or {{Zerg}}.
data.outputDescription: <<[[k]] lines:>> An integer with the maximum number of {{Zerg}} at the current round.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given the pairings of an elimination tournament with n = 2 ** k players of the game Starcraft. Each player plays one race from either: Terran, Protoss or Zerg.

You are very worried about game balance and decide to figure out the maximum number of Zerg players that can qualify in the successive k rounds. Print the result in k lines.

NOTE: The pairings are made by successively choosing two consecutive remaining players. That is:


Zerg    --
          |-- Next player --
Terran  --                  |
                            |-- Next player
Terran  --                  |
          |-- Next player --
Protoss --
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of players in the tournament.
Next n lines: The race of the player. Either Terran, Protoss or Zerg.
Output
k lines: An integer with the maximum number of Zerg at the current round.
Constraints
There is an integer k such that n = 2 ** k (n is a power of two).
4 <= n <= 64
Example
Input
4
Protoss
Zerg
Terran
Terran
Output
1
1
